intro: Gonolobus gracilis, commonly known as slender goatweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or violet in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks. Gonolobus gracilis is sometimes considered a weed but can serve as a host plant for certain insects.
